text:
Try to get a few OpenType reference fonts that can be distributed with FOP for
testing and demonstration. Ask some font editors. 

The fonts could be crippled if they want, for example by removing portions of
the glyph sets.

Free fonts can be found at:
http://www.nongnu.org/freefont/

Unfortunately they are not for immediate download in otf format, but can be converted using:
http://fontforge.sourceforge.net/

hth

Max

text:
The  DejaVu Fonts have a very liberal license which may be compatible with the ASL:

http://dejavu.sourceforge.net/wiki/index.php/License

The are also available for download in SFD (FontForge) format, which can be used to create OpenType 
fonts.

Also, the Stixfonts (bug #40468) are now scheduled for a beta release for the end of this month.  Be 
warned though, that previous promised dates have always been pushed back.
creator: max@berger.name

creator: jeremias@apache.org

text:
Just because I am really happy about this fact, I've downloaded the dejavu
sources and converted them to otf. The results are available at:

http://max.berger.name/tmp/dejavu-otf-2.18.zip

(7.7MB, for a limited time)

Steps to reproduce:
- download recent fontforge
- download dejavu sfd sources
- modify generate.pe to produce .otf instead of .ttf
- run generate.sh, ingore error in postprocess script
- results are in generated/

To test all OTF features, the generation may have to be run with different
parameters, which would require more modification to the .pe file. I am not sure
which features are present in these files.
